article.para: Ulteo OVD is configured by a web interface installed on the Session Manager called Administration Console or just console.
This documentation explain the features pages by pages following the menu.

section.title: Log into the console
section.para: As you saw at the installation, the console is available using a web browser and typing the url http://ip.or.host/sessionmanager/admin/ where ip.or.host is the name or IP adress of the machine you installed your Session Manager.
You can login with the admin account. You can also login with OVD users if you authorized to do that as we'll see later.
Once logged, you are redirected to the main page. This page is just shortcut and link to some informations about the system. Let's following the menu.

section.title: Server Management
section.para: This category is about the application servers management. It's also include the Shared Folders page.

section.title: Servers page
section.para: In the first page, you can see the list of Application Server plugged to your Session Manager with some details.
By clicking on the FQDN link or on the Manage button, you enter in a manage page that give full details on a specific server.

simplesect.title: Specific server managment

listitem.para: Number of available sessions on this server: This value is not a limit for each Application Server but a value used by the load balancing algorithm as we'll see later.

Redirection name of this server: this is used to launch session. When you launch a session, you are redirected to an Application server using the redirection name as redirection. In some cases the default redirection name (the FQDN you gave at the ApS installation) is not valid. For instance, if you setup an private IP address and you want to connect from Internet.

itemizedlist.listitem:
Web port of this server: This is the port where the Application Server listen for webserices access from the Session Manager.
You shouldn't modify this value unless you are sure of what you are doing

listitem.para: The maintenance/production is a status. This status is used to keep some servers online and ready to use on maintenance to be sure that no sessions are going to be launch. It's usefull when perfoming software upgrade for instance.

simplesect.para: On the Linux application, it's possible to install applications directly from console by giving a package name. It's also possible to ask for upgrade the server. It'll upgrade the applications and the Ulteo software.

section.title: Unregistered servers page
section.para: An Application server is unregistered untill an admin registers it by clicking the register button.

section.title: Tasks page
section.para: This is only available on Linux server yet. A tasks is a request to a Application Server to install/remove an application as we talked in the servers page.
This page just list the known tasks with their status.

section.title: Shared folders page
section.para: Shared folders is a feature to allow members of users groups to work together on a virtual drive.
To make it work, create one, add some users groups to this start a session.

important.para: You have to turn it on the Shared folder for session by clicking on the button on the Shared folder page.

section.para: This page just list the known tasks with their status.

section.title: Users
section.para: This category is about the user and the users groups.
Each user is shown with his login, his display name, his uid and all other extra fields from the user database.
You can get more information about a User either by clicking the Manage button or by clicking on the user login hyperlink.

section.title: Manage a user
section.para: In this page, we can modify each user attribute if the user database is writable. Actually, only MySQL module is writable.
There is also the list of user groups that contain this user and the list of active sessions for this user.

section.title: User Group Management
section.para: This page provides a list of user group with their name, their description and their status (Enabled or Block). You also can add and remove user groups.
The Manage page of a specific group lets you change status and description. It's also possible to add or remove users from a specific group and view the list of publications for a specific group.

section.title: Applications Management
section.para: This page shows the list of applications which are (physically) installed on the application servers.
Each application is shown with his name, his description and his type (Linux or Windows).
You can have more information about an application either by clicking the Manage button or by clicking on the application name hyperlink.

section.title: Manage an application
section.para: When you manage an application, you can add or remove this application from online servers and from the application groups.

section.title: Application group Management
section.para: This page provides a list of application groups with their name, their description and their status (Enabled or Blocked). You can also add and remove application groups.

The manage page of a specific group lets you change the status and the description. It's also possible to add or remove users from a specific group and view the list of publications for a specific group.

section.title: Static applications page
section.para: Static application are application that have not be detected automatically on an Application Server. It's set directly on the console. It could be w Web application for instance.

section.title: Publications
section.para: This page shows associations between user groups and application groups. A publication wizard is available to make the process simple.

This wizard is in 3 main steps:
selection of users
selection of applications
confirmations
If you choose users from the user list instead of an existing user group, the system is going to ask you for a user group name and description. It's the same for application selection.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: At this page, you can configure your sesion manager.
Be careful when you change the config, it can break actives session depending on the kind of action.

section.title: Database settings page
section.para: In this page, it's possible to change the information the MySQL database used by the OVD.

important.para: If you change informations on this page, you can break your system, delete your users groups or other information.

section.title: System settings page
section.para: In this page, it's possible to customize the language of the console. It's also possible to change the admin policy for OVD users.

section.title: Policy
section.para: By modifying the policy, you authorized each of your OVD users to perform some admin actions. It's a default policy, it's can be override by customize the policy for a users group.
For instance, if you select user admin panel, you authorizing every OVD users to logon the admin console.

note.para: We advice to keep disable all field of the default policy.

section.title: Server settings page
section.para: This page is about the Applications servers settings.

simplesect.title: Load balancing
simplesect.para: The load balancing is used to choose the server to use when a user request for a session. It's possible to customize the algorithm to change the priority of the criterians.

section.title: Profile settings page
section.para: Ulteo OVD can be plugged to LDAP or Active Directory or keep is own local database.

section.title: Session Configuration
section.para: This part is about the default configuration of the session and what the user can force.

section.title: Events Configuration
section.para: In this page, you can give email adress to receive alert when events occurs.

section.title: Web interface settings page
section.para: This page is about the configuration of the Ulteo OVD main page (the one you use to start sessions).

section.title: Session page
section.para:
This page shows a list of active sessions with the following information:
Session: the session id
Server: the server where the session runs
User: the user which started the session
It's possible to end a session by clicking the Kill button.
You can have more information about a session by clicking on the session id.

section.title: Manage a session
section.para:
On the general page, there are two additional features:
The date when the session started
A button to join the session using the desktop sharing system

section.title: Logs page
section.para: This page show the log on the Session Manager. The log level depends on the configuration set in the Configuration System settings page.

section.title: Reporting page
section.para: This page give you a report of you OVD infrastructure in a time window you select.

section.title: Summary page
section.para: Ths summary page show all links between user, users groups, applications, applications groups and server.
This page is very usefull when you are lost in the publication or when you don't why you can't start sessions.

important.para: This page can take time to load if you have many users in your database. Use it carrefully.
